text: Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation.

However, communication from the country of Larkinson was not heard from as people had hoped on the day it had said seven years ago it would end its isolation. In fact, satellite imaging and other surveillance showed that its towns and cities were empty, having no people seemingly alive and moving. The country was completely devoid of life, and it was unknown what had happened to the country. 

The United Nations sent a team of investigators to the country to find out what had happened. Upon closer inspection, the investigators could not find anything that could explain why all the citizens of the country of Larkinson had vanished. No evidence of natural disasters, no destruction of their buildings, and no records of what happened during the seven years of isolation.

Upon closer inspection, the investigators could not find anything that could explain why all the citizens of the country of Larkinson had vanished. No evidence of natural disasters, no destruction of their buildings, and no records of what happened during the seven years of isolation were found.

However, communication from the country of Larkinson was not heard from as people had hoped on the day it had said seven years ago it would end its isolation. In fact, satellite imaging and other surveillance showed that its towns and cities were empty, having no people seemingly alive and moving. The country was completely devoid of life, and it was unknown what had happened to the country. 

The United Nations sent a team of investigators to the country to find out what had happened. Upon closer inspection, the investigators could not find anything that could explain why all the citizens of the country of Larkinson had vanished. No evidence of natural disasters, no destruction of their buildings, and no records of what happened during the seven years of isolation were found. The investigators could not find any clues as to what happened to the country, and they were forced to leave.

The United Nations sent a team of investigators to the country to find out what had happened. Upon closer inspection, the investigators could not find anything that could explain why all the citizens of the country of Larkinson had vanished. No evidence of natural disasters, no destruction of their buildings, and no records of what happened during the seven years of isolation were found. The investigators could not find any clues as to what happened to the country, and they disclosed their findings to the UN, ultimately confirming that the country of Larkinson was no more. The nations of the world mourned the loss of the country, and ultimately set up a day to acknowledge the travesty that befell it.

That isn't to say that the mourning lasted forever, as the other countries of the world begin to excavate and acquire the resources of Larkinson, having made an agreement to share the Larkinsonite they would find among each other. Sure enough, the Larkinsonite was excavated from the ground, and the countries of the world began to use it to their advantage.

The year is 3102, and the people of the world await the country of Larkinson to open up its borders once again. No evidence of natural disasters, no destruction of their buildings, and no records of what happened during the seven years of isolation were found. The investigators could not find any clues as to what happened to the country, and they disclosed their findings to the UN, ultimately confirming that the country of Larkinson was no more. The nations of the world mourned the loss of the country, and ultimately set up a day to acknowledge the travesty that befell it.

That isn't to say that the mourning lasted forever, as the other countries of the world begin to excavate and acquire the resources of Larkinson, having made an agreement to share the Larkinsonite they would find among each other. Sure enough, the Larkinsonite was excavated from the ground, and the countries of the world began to use it to their advantage. Through time, scientists had been able to replicate the innovative material, which allowed technology to prosper even further as the nations of the world now had access to the material from the confines of its own borders. Larkinson was soon then no longer a point of interest for the world, especially so as its supply of Larkinson dwindled.

Although people would eventually forget that the country of Larkinson ever existed, the country would truly never be forgotten for how it revolutionized society and impacted its technological growth in the coming years.
